itemselectr 0.1
  • Reference

Reverse code items

reverse.code.Rd

Reflects the scoring of items

Usage

reverse.code(x, min.score, max.score, items)

Arguments

x

Data frame containing items, some of which may need to be reverse coded

min.score

Minimum possible score on the items

max.score

Maximum possible score on the items

items

A vector of item names or column numbers of items that need to be reverse coded

Value

A data frame

Examples

library(psychTools)
data(bfi)

## Perform principal components analysis to observe the signs of the component loadings
psych::pca(bfi[1:25], 5)
#> Principal Components Analysis

#>     method = method, use = use, cor = cor, correct = 0.5, weight = NULL)

items <- c("A1", "C4", "C5", "E1", "E2", "O2", "O5")
bfi.new <- reverse.code(bfi[1:25], min.score = 1, max.score = 6, items)
#> Error in reverse.code(bfi[1:25], min.score = 1, max.score = 6, items): unused arguments (min.score = 1, max.score = 6)
